title: MOOC Design Strategies for Strengthening Scientific Inquiry Competencies of Large-Scale Elementary Science Learners

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced-level expertise in the field (science education theory, experimental design methodologies) and extensive practical experience
context.additional_context: Conducting asynchronous learning in digital device (tablet/PC)-provided environments. Utilizes LMS-based videos (virtual lab demonstrations), quizzes (variable analysis problems), and discussion boards (scientific argumentation activities)

learning_goals: Explain three or more strategies for building assessment systems linked to the scientific inquiry process (observation-hypothesis-experiment-analysis-conclusion) in MOOC design
Discuss experimental designs for controlling variables tailored to large learner groups and apply two or more peer assessment techniques
Develop scientific data visualization content plans considering technical limitations of LMS platforms
Cultivate the ability to design modular content that organizes beginner-level science concepts (basic physics, chemistry, biology) in a stepwise and non-linear manner
Propose personalized learning path improvements using formative assessment data (experiment result analysis, hypothesis verification accuracy, etc.)
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
